//Black moon rise, white comet set//

//Put the guns into play, on your lips, into my coffers//

//What kind of mire have we started?//

//Will we ever find its end?//

//Likened selves on the top of the world ache for other mountains//

//Their valleys plunge into death’s shadow, uncertainty collapsing//

//As life extracts itself, the passage of time beaten//

//Ask the question—when can we stop counting?//

//Our years, our moments, our lost greed?//

//When can that commensurate knot finally tie?//

//To whom do we owe debts, to whom are we creditors?//

//What fates have we sealed, what heads will need to roll?//

//And where do betrayals of the highest order lie, my dear?//

A multi-decade love story between a (former) Foundation Overseer, Selena Ruiz Montgomery Cortez and the CEO of Marshall, Carter, and Dark Ltd., Percival Atherolis Darke. Featuring a father, a mother, a dead-end job, an Internal Affairs agent with maternal dreams, a miserable pile of secrets, an extremely seductive cannibal, uncertainty in three business suits, and two women who find they are a lot more alike than perhaps they first thought.
